parse: Verb - Present Imperative Middle or Passive - 2nd Person Plural
str2: A prolongation and middle voice form of a primary verb; to cause to be, i.e. to become, used with great latitude.
Useful, gentle, pleasant, kind. From chraomai; employed, i.e. useful.
Tender-hearted, merciful, compassionate. From eu and splagchnon; well compassioned, i.e. Sympathetic.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.

parse: Personal / Reciprocal Pronoun - Accusative Masculine Plural
str2: One another, each other. Genitive plural from allos reduplicated; one another.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: (a) To show favor to, (b) To pardon, forgive, (c) To show kindness.

parse: Reflexive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Plural

str2: According to the manner in which, in the degree that, just as, as. From kata and hos; just as, that.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Anointed One; the Messiah, the Christ. From chrio; Anointed One, i.e. The Messiah, an epithet of Jesus.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Singular
str2: (a) To show favor to, (b) To pardon, forgive, (c) To show kindness.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
